intro: Antidaphne paraensis var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf antidaphne, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae, characterized by its showy, often fragrant flowers. The leaves of this plant are typically broad and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in dense undergrowth of rainforests. The plant contains various alkaloids, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
